page.title: 13Local History of The Lee
page.content: Little is known of the{Iron Age} emplacement in Bray's Wood. {Middle Ages}A site of 7.5 acres, near Church Farm, is bounded by earthworks. It is probably from 13/14th C when The Lee was granted to Missenden Abbey. Within the earthworks, the{Old Church, which is a Grade 1 listed building, & some glass in the E. window, are 13th century. It was faced with redundancy in 1977,but villagers raised money for repairs. The roof, heating & lighting systems are new, & rotten panelling removed. {Mediaeval wall paintings have been uncovered & further work & repairs to the E. window are planned. {The Lee Well}The Jubilee well was financed by public subscription in 1897 for Q. Victoria's Jubilee. It is 365 ft deep, water being raised in conical buckets. It was last used in 1952 to water the allotments.
